discourse_list.title: Know Your MIP KYM #11: MIP40: Core Unit Budget Process, Friday, June 10th 16:00 UTC

content.content: Know Your MIP #11: MIP40: Core Unit Budget Process Wow. It’s been ~ten months since the last instalment of the Know Your MIP series. Time really does fly when you’re stressed out having fun!  For the 11th episode of Know Your MIP, we’ll have Adrian (@adcv) guiding us through the newly amended MIP40: Budget Framework, which introduces some rather large changes to the Core Unit budget process. @blimpa and @gala will be doing the(ir very first) hosting   When June 10, 2022 @ 16:00 UTC Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-06-10T16:00:00Z Google Calendar  Where Join Zoom Meeting   Zoom Video   Join our Cloud HD Video Meeting Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise video communications, with an easy, reliable cloud platform for video and audio conferencing, chat, and webinars across mobile, desktop, and room systems. Zoom Rooms is the original software-based conference...      Meeting ID: 838 9565 1120 Passcode: KYM40 See you there!  attn: @Core-Facilitators, @Recognized-Delegates

Know Your MIP #11 - Summary June 10th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Pablo  01:02: Presentation, Questions and Discussion about MIP40 Budget Framework with Adrian.  51:20: Outro   Video https://youtu.be/P2FiO-KdbIg  Introduction  Pablo  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Hello to everyone. I am Pablo from GovAlpha Core Unit. Welcome to episode #11 of Know Your MIP, the series where we go in-depth on MIPs. We are back after the longest hiatus yet. For this episode, we have with us Adrian @adcv from Strategic Finance. He is one of the authors of a recently ratified amendment that introduced big changes in MIP40, the MIP that defines how CU budgets are to be handled. Adrian will walk us through the MIP and the process of putting a budget together under the new framework. For other episodes of KYM, please check the forum.   Presentation  Adrian 01:34  MIP40/Portal   Questions 01:02 - Pablo: What was the motivation for this amendment? 6:28 - Pablo: Are you going to walk us through the amendment now, or are you going to put together a budget? 11:49 - Tim Black: Folks are a little nervous in any operational context to show their work. When we articulate an example of teams providing ROI, can we talk about how reducing that term introduces more breadth for success? 16:05 - Jon Perry: In this new MIP, the section where you have to demonstrate financial benchmarks or value is more about a PR type. The ROI may not be a direct financial thing? 20:57 - Jon Perry: I am trying to think of ways to benchmark goals or results of events, but it is hard because people are chatting, and something happens, and we do not know about it. 27:14 - Payton Rose: If you do not have your budget increase approved. Do you have any recommendations about the best practices for facilitators to plan for that? 33:18 - Pablo: We skipped Reporting and Transparency. 36:23 - Jon Perry: Governance hopes that it is just the delegates doing all this and that casual MKR holders come in and choose to participate as well. Suppose it is in a known window in a cycle, then it is easier to jump onto. It adds more clarity. 38:40 - Tadeo: With this new window change, does it mean I need to push it back a month and start a month earlier? 39:39 - Tadeo: My mandate finishes in May. Whether I have extra money or not, I should not go past may without a new mandate and budget approved. 40:45 - Tadeo: If the problem were that we had too many budgets ongoing at the same time, would not the windows make it worse? 44:21 - Tadeo: In the end, do not we still have more or less the same amount of non-budget-related votes happening every single month? 47:55 - Last comment from @adcv  Closing Comment  Pablo  Outro 51:20  If people feel this was valuable and are interested in a second part to this KYM, we can organize that. I want to thank everyone. Thank you, Adrian, for the walkthrough. Please let us keep the discussion going in the forum, particularly in this thread. Just a reminder, we have Know Your MIP #12 with Tim Black on Tuesday 14th at 17 UTC about the CU affording process amendment.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
